data.title: Ocean - National Geographic Kids
data.description: How do chameleons change color? When was the light bulb invented? Why can't cats and dogs be friends? Want to know the answers to these and hundreds of other questions? Then just ask Dr. Universe, the world's most curious cat!

data.title: Ask Doctor Universe - PBS Kids
data.description: An ocean is a major body of saline water, and a principal component of the hydrosphere. Approximately 70.9% of the Earth's surface (~3.61 X 1014 m2) is covered by ocean, a continuous body of water that is customarily divided into several principal oceans and smaller seas.

data.title: Ocean Life - PBS Kids
data.description: This page can be enrichment for children in the lower elementary grades. Learners will be presented with information on different types of Oceanlife. In addition to the lesson, there is a quiz and some fun things that kids can do online or print out.

data.title: Zipper's Green Tips - National Geographic Kids
data.description: Trees help clean the air we breathe. They produce oxygen and reduce carbon. Pollution is a growing problem for all the Earth's ocean and its wildlife.

data.title: Ten Freaky Forces of Nature
data.description: Nature can be unbelievably powerful. A major earthquake can topple huge buildings and bring down entire mountainsides. At Niagara Falls, more than 500,000 gallons (1,892,705 liters) of water crash down 18 stories into the Niagara River every second—enough to fill nearly 50 Olympic-size swimming pools in a minute! And everyone knows about hurricanes, blizzards, avalanches, forest fires, floods, tidal waves, and even thunderstorms. But if you thought Mother Nature didn't have many surprises up her sleeve, think again. Nature has a load of other powers that, while less well-known, can only be described as, well, freaky.

data.title: Finding Nemo Trailer
data.description: Nemo's dad drops him off at his first day of school. Clownfish Marlin and his son, Nemo, become separated in the Great Barrier Reef. Nemo is whisked away to a fish tank in a dentist's office. Friendly Pollyanna-like sidekick Dory braves the predators of the deep with Marlin in the search for his son.
